results.title: Kiss me Petruchio
results.creator_credit: Christopher Dixon, Wilford Leach, Joseph Papp and New York Shakespeare Festival
results.brief_description: An amusing, fast-paced documentary based on the New York Shakespeare Festival’s production of “The Taming of the Shrew” starring Meryl Streep and Raul Julia. The film goes behind the scenes to find out what makes the 400-year-old play relevant to audiences today. Combines excerpts from the performance, with comments by the leading actors and members of the audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Dixon, Wilford Leach, Joseph Papp and New York Shakespeare Festival

results.title: Facing it: my friend's an alcoholic
results.creator_credit: William Haugse, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Terry, 17, has a drinking and drug problem and his friend, A.J., is being drawn into it. A.J. at first covers for Terry, then tries to intervene. Finally he realises, with the assistance of Terry’s girlfriend, that they need outside help.

results.title: Game to Play
results.brief_description: A look at the ongoing problems that involve both children and adults, with junior sports participation. Parent’s, teachers, coaches and children themselves discuss the pro’s and con’s of competitive sport.

results.title: Ride straight Kate
results.creator_credit: Lynda House, Tony Mahood and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Jason collides with a car while out riding his bicycle and is admitted to hospital. His friends decide to visit him and during their ride to and from the hospital they are confronted with several situations where accidents could occur because of their own or others’ carelessness. This program examines, in an interesting manner, safe cycling practices.

results.title: [Ch'u Fou: birthplace of Confucius]
results.brief_description: Documentary film about Ch’u Fou, Shantung Province, the birthplace of K’ung-Fu-Tze (Confucius, 551-478 B.C.). Examples of the architecture, art and sculpture of this period are shown including the Chinese Classroom, built many centuries later in dedication to the memory of Confucius and his democratic ideal of a classless education. Temples, stone carvings and ancient Chinese culture are luxuriously presented in this historically informative film. English language, Chinese title and credits.
